testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
After RIP enable, GW can establish neighbors with other routers, VPN tunnel establish
Test Procedure:
1. Enable RIPv2 on GW, Enable RIP advertise on both interface wan and lan, result 1 2.VPN tunnel is broken, then recover, result 2 3.Modify the background networking under the other routers, such as add, delete some subnets, result 3 4.Modify mgt0.x ip on BR, such as add/delete mgt0.x, change the ip of mgt0.x, result 4 5.Disable RIPv2 on GW, result 5

step.setvar: if [ "yes" == "${cvg1.cvg.fw_existed}" ]; then echo "${cvg1.cvg.mip.ip}" else echo "${cvg1.cvg.wan.ip}" fi

step.desc: set BR interface
Enable DHCP server on interface mgt0.1
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config CVG act as l3 VPN server
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ee-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_cert.pem" -v "save vpn private-key tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_key.pem" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${vpn.client.list} local" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${vpn.client.list} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn server-ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name} vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name} client-list ${vpn.client.list}" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy server ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v "" -v "_debug brd info" -v "" -v "_debug brd basic" -v ""

step.desc: config BR as l3 VPN client
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ca-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/cacert.pem" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 gateway ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy client ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 primary" -v "routing route-request enable" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "_debug brd info" -v "" -v "_debug brd basic" -v ""

step.desc: check vpn ike sa on BR side destination to CVG public address
check vpn ike sa on CVG side destionation to BR public address
check gre tunnel on br side remote to CVG wan address, local mgt0 address ,gateway CVG public address
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan address

step.multi-setvar: echo "cvg1.cvg.lan.route=$(echo ${cvg1.cvg.lan.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.vpc1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.cvg.lan2.route=$(echo ${cvg1.cvg.lan2.gateway} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br1.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br1.br.mgt0.2.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br1.br.mgt0.4.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0"

step.desc: RIP is enabled on GW, interface lan can learn routes from neighbor routers, and update the routes’ status periodically (30s); BR pulls routes from GW through tunnel periodically (60s), and GW will push the routes about lan and other BRs
Enable RIP on GW, Enable RIP advertise on interface eth1
step.telnet: -v "routing protocol ripv2 advertise eth1" -v "routing protocol type ripv2" -v "routing protocol enable"

step.desc: enable rip on eth0 if it has one arms
step.telnet: -v "routing protocol ripv2 advertise eth0" -v "routing protocol type ripv2" -v "routing protocol enable"

step.desc: On GW, interfaces lan can learn routes from neighbor routers, and update the routes’ status while receive the update message
BR pulls routes from GW through tunnel periodically (60s), and GW will push the routes about lan and other BRs
VPN tunnel is broken, then recover, BR pulls routes from GW through tunnel periodically (60s), and GW will push the routes about lan and other BRs
VPN tunnel is broken
step.telnet: -v "no vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 gateway ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive"

step.desc: tunnel broken, route learn from CVG will be deleted
On GW, route from BR will be deleted while tunnel was broken.
VPN tunnel is recover
check vpn ike sa on BR side destination to CVG public address
check vpn ike sa on CVG side destionation to BR public address
On GW, interfaces lan can learn routes from neighbor routers, and update the routes’ status while receive the update message
BR pulls routes from GW through tunnel periodically (60s), and GW will push the routes about lan and other BRs
Modify mgt0.x ip on BR, such as add/delete mgt0.x, change the ip of mgt0.x, BR will send the event to GW about the modification, and GW will update its route table
add interface mgt0.2 on BR
On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
delete interface mgt0.2 on BR
On GW, will delete the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
modify interface mgt0.2 IP on BR
On GW, will change the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
Modify the background networking under the other routers, GW will update the routes from other routers by updating message, while BR pulls routes from GW, it can get the latest route info
On GW, will change the routes according L3SW modification
On BR, will add the tunnel routes according to CVG's modification
On BR, will delete the tunnel routes according to CVG's modification
RIP is disabled on GW, all routes learned from RIP will be deleted, BR can’t get the routes about RIP from GW
Disable RIP on GW
RIP is disabled on GW, all routes learned from RIP will be deleted
BR can’t get the routes about RIP from GW
